projects.name: Filmo
projects.description: On this app you can search any movie or tv show. You can sign up and create custom lists, like Best Movies Ever. Also, you can use the default lists: Want-To-See and Seen-It.
projects.technique: The Movies/TV Shows database is extracted from TheMovieDB API. The user authentication is through Firebase. And I saved the users lists on Firestore. In this project I used React, React-Router, Redux, styled-components, axios, among others technologies or libraries.

projects.name: FormulaOne
projects.description: It's a Formula 1 project where you can see the rankings, drivers, teams, seasons and circuits.
projects.technique: I used JavaScript Vanilla to build this SPA. I used Sass for the styles. In this project I applied the JavaScript OOP concept. It's a pretty simple project in which I mainly make the requests from the formula-1 API, found it in api-sports.io.

projects.name: Eleven Builder
projects.description: You can add players, putting them name, surname and image. Also, you can move the players around the field and the bench. And you can change the Team-Title.
projects.technique: It was one of my first projects. The main concept is DOM manipulation in JavaScript Vanilla. The website isn't even responsive.

projects.name: Portfolio
projects.description: This is my portfolio. You can see my projects, read about me and send me a contact message.
projects.technique: I used React, Redux, styled-components and TailwindCSS. Also, I used My-JSON-Server to save the data and extract it. I handle the contact form with Formspree. Where do I used Redux? In the ToastMessage, that is showed when you sent the contact form, for example. I think is the best UI/UX that I did, possibly helped by TailwindCSS.
